content.text: What approach is good to integrate collab-editing's server features?
I had succeed to make the demo page with collab-editor using Prosemirror.
My demo page had been built base on this source "https://github.com/ProseMirror/website/tree/master/src/collab/".
I expect that client module is not much hard to porting on our solution. ("website/src/collab/client/").
But the server-side module.("website/src/collab/server/"). That made by node-server and using json based Data persistence.
It is considered that I should decide few right decision.
Question 1.
I think that The server-side module is just one of the demo implementations of lot of possible ways.
So I have to build own implementation on ours. Is this right thinking?
Question 2.
The our new editor's js file can be served from the main app-server. and the polling target-server from collab-editing also served can be . Is it just ok? Is there anything I have to consider?
(ex) The collab's polling target server and main-app server must be seperated. (Because of too many polling and events  requests.)
Question 3.
My plan would be the feauture on server-side module.
Business Plan
Give away software
Profit!!!

;; This buffer is for notes you don't want to save, and for Lisp evaluation.
;; If you want to create a file, visit that file with C-x C-f,
;; then enter the text in that file's own buffer.
Mona tried to tell me
To stay away from the train line.
She said that all the railroad men
Just drink up your blood like wine.
An' I said, “Oh, I didn't know that,
But then again, there's only one I've met
An' he just smoked my eyelids
An' punched my cigarette.”
Oh, Mama, can this really be the end,
To be stuck inside of Mobile
With the Memphis blues again.
— Bob Dylan,
Stuck Inside of Mobile with the Memphis Blues Again
